experiments.title: Velocity and Acceleration
experiments.theory: Velocity is the rate of change of displacement, while acceleration is the rate of change of velocity.
experiments.result: Concepts of velocity and acceleration are understood.
precautions: Understand difference between velocity and acceleration.

experiments.title: Magnetic Field Between Two Wires
experiments.aim: To study magnetic interaction between current-carrying wires.
experiments.theory: Current-carrying conductors produce magnetic fields which interact with each other.
experiments.result: Interaction between magnetic fields is understood.

experiments.title: Right-Hand Thumb Rule
experiments.aim: To determine the direction of magnetic field using thumb rule.
experiments.theory: The right-hand thumb rule helps determine the direction of magnetic field around a conductor.
experiments.observation: Direction of magnetic field is clearly shown.

experiments.title: Direction of Magnetic Field Around a Conductor
experiments.aim: To determine the direction of magnetic field around a straight conductor.
experiments.theory: A current-carrying straight conductor produces circular magnetic field lines around it.
experiments.observation: Circular magnetic field lines are visible.
